physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient presents with chronic severe major depression; history of morbid obesity, poorly controlled hypertension, and type 2 diabetes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood pressure remained elevated at baseline levels during follow-up. After 18 months, blood pressure measurements increased to 200/120 mmHg and heart rate to 120 bpm.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: On examination in the emergency department, ECG normal except for sinus tachycardia at 108 bpm.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After administration of missed medications, blood pressure decreased to 193/94 mmHg and heart rate to 92 bpm; blood glucose decreased to 147 mg/dl.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Follow-up thyroid function testing after 90 days showed normal results for TSH, total T3, and free T4.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Medication adherence improved with normalization of thyroid function tests and clinical response was reported as excellent.
